newsitem.title: USA: Cargill to reopen one Cincinnati grain terminal.
newsitem.headline: Cargill to reopen one Cincinnati grain terminal.

text.p: Cargill Inc said it will reopen its Cincinnati grain terminal on River Road Monday, but its other Cincinnati facility on Kellogg Ave will remain closed indefinitely.

Both facilities were damaged by the worst Ohio River flooding in decades, but the Kellogg facility was hardest hit sustaining damage to its conveyor and grain dryer systems. Also, at the height of the flooding two grain bins at the facility split open when soybeans inside swelled from the flood waters.
Asked when the Kellogg facility will reopen, Cargill spokeswoman Lori Johnson said "We don't have an estimated time. We are still in kind of a cleanup mode."
